statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: A wqb-number, or B-number for short, is a non-negative integer whose decimal form contains the sub- string "13" and can be divided by 13. For example, 130 and 2613 are wqb-numbers, but 143 and 2639 are not. Your task is to calculate how many wqb-numbers from 1 to n for a given integer n.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: Process till EOF. In each line, there is one positive integer n(1 <= n <= 1000000000).

statement.title: Output
statement.content: Print each answer in a single line.

statement.title: Source
statement.content: 2010 Asia Regional Chengdu Site —— Online Contest
